pli-tv-pvr1.3:0.4.eng: The classes of failure for each offense

pli-tv-pvr1.3:1.1.pli: Methunaṃ dhammaṃ paṭisevantassa āpattiyo catunnaṃ vipattīnaṃ kati vipattiyo bhajanti?
pli-tv-pvr1.3:1.1.eng: When it comes to the offenses for having sexual intercourse, to how many of the four kinds of failure do they belong?

pli-tv-pvr1.3:1.2.pli: Methunaṃ dhammaṃ paṭisevantassa āpattiyo catunnaṃ vipattīnaṃ dve vipattiyo bhajanti—
pli-tv-pvr1.3:1.2.eng: They belong to two kinds of failure:

pli-tv-pvr1.3:1.3.eng: they may be failure in morality; they may be failure in conduct. …

pli-tv-pvr1.3:2.1.pli: Anādariyaṃ paṭicca udake uccāraṃ vā passāvaṃ vā kheḷaṃ vā karontassa āpatti catunnaṃ vipattīnaṃ kati vipattiyo bhajati?
pli-tv-pvr1.3:2.1.eng: When it comes to the offense for, out of disrespect, defecating, urinating, or spitting in water, to how many of the four kinds of failure does it belong?

pli-tv-pvr1.3:2.2.pli: Anādariyaṃ paṭicca udake uccāraṃ vā passāvaṃ vā kheḷaṃ vā karontassa āpatti catunnaṃ vipattīnaṃ ekaṃ vipattiṃ bhajati—
pli-tv-pvr1.3:2.2.eng: It belongs to one kind of failure:

pli-tv-pvr1.3:3.1.eng: The classes of failure for each offense, the third, are finished.

pli-tv-pvr1.4:0.4.eng: The classes of offenses in each offense

pli-tv-pvr1.4:1.1.pli: Methunaṃ dhammaṃ paṭisevantassa āpattiyo sattannaṃ āpattikkhandhānaṃ katihi āpattikkhandhehi saṅgahitā?
pli-tv-pvr1.4:1.1.eng: When it comes to the offenses for having sexual intercourse, in how many of the seven classes of offenses are they found?

pli-tv-pvr1.4:1.2.pli: Methunaṃ dhammaṃ paṭisevantassa āpattiyo sattannaṃ āpattikkhandhānaṃ tīhi āpattikkhandhehi saṅgahitā—

pli-tv-pvr1.4:1.3.pli: siyā pārājikāpattikkhandhena, siyā thullaccayāpattikkhandhena, siyā dukkaṭāpattikkhandhena …pe….
pli-tv-pvr1.4:1.3.eng: they may be in the class of offenses entailing expulsion; they may be in the class of serious offenses; they may be in the class of offenses of wrong conduct. …

pli-tv-pvr1.4:2.1.pli: Anādariyaṃ paṭicca udake uccāraṃ vā passāvaṃ vā kheḷaṃ vā karontassa āpatti sattannaṃ āpattikkhandhānaṃ katihi āpattikkhandhehi saṅgahitā?
pli-tv-pvr1.4:2.1.eng: When it comes to the offense for, out of disrespect, defecating, urinating, or spitting in water, in how many of the seven classes of offenses is it found?

pli-tv-pvr1.4:2.2.pli: Anādariyaṃ paṭicca udake uccāraṃ vā passāvaṃ vā kheḷaṃ vā karontassa āpatti sattannaṃ āpattikkhandhānaṃ ekena āpattikkhandhena saṅgahitā—

pli-tv-pvr1.4:2.3.eng: in the class of offenses of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-pvr1.4:3.1.eng: The classes of offenses in each offense, the fourth, are finished.

pli-tv-pvr1.5:1.1.pli: Methunaṃ dhammaṃ paṭisevantassa āpattiyo channaṃ āpattisamuṭṭhānānaṃ katihi samuṭṭhānehi samuṭṭhanti?
pli-tv-pvr1.5:1.1.eng: When it comes to the offenses for having sexual intercourse, through how many of the six kinds of originations of offenses do they originate?

pli-tv-pvr1.5:1.2.pli: Methunaṃ dhammaṃ paṭisevantassa āpattiyo channaṃ āpattisamuṭṭhānānaṃ ekena samuṭṭhānena samuṭṭhanti—

pli-tv-pvr1.5:1.3.pli: kāyato ca cittato ca samuṭṭhanti, na vācato …pe….
pli-tv-pvr1.5:1.3.eng: from body and mind, not from speech. …

pli-tv-pvr1.5:2.1.pli: Anādariyaṃ paṭicca udake uccāraṃ vā passāvaṃ vā kheḷaṃ vā karontassa āpatti channaṃ āpattisamuṭṭhānānaṃ katihi samuṭṭhānehi samuṭṭhāti?
pli-tv-pvr1.5:2.1.eng: When it comes to the offense for, out of disrespect, defecating, urinating, or spitting in water, through how many of the six kinds of originations of offenses does it originate?

pli-tv-pvr1.5:2.2.pli: Anādariyaṃ paṭicca udake uccāraṃ vā passāvaṃ vā kheḷaṃ vā karontassa āpatti channaṃ āpattisamuṭṭhānānaṃ ekena samuṭṭhānena samuṭṭhāti—

pli-tv-pvr1.5:2.3.pli: kāyato ca cittato ca samuṭṭhāti, na vācato.
pli-tv-pvr1.5:2.3.eng: from body and mind, not from speech.

pli-tv-pvr1.5:3.1.eng: The originations of each offense, the fifth, are finished.

pli-tv-pvr1.6:0.4.eng: The legal issues to which each offense belongs

pli-tv-pvr1.6:1.1.pli: Methunaṃ dhammaṃ paṭisevantassa āpattiyo catunnaṃ adhikaraṇānaṃ katamaṃ adhikaraṇaṃ?
pli-tv-pvr1.6:1.1.eng: When it comes to the offenses for having sexual intercourse, to which of the four kinds of legal issues do they belong?

pli-tv-pvr1.6:1.2.pli: Methunaṃ dhammaṃ paṭisevantassa āpattiyo catunnaṃ adhikaraṇānaṃ āpattādhikaraṇaṃ …pe….
pli-tv-pvr1.6:1.2.eng: They belong to legal issues arising from an offense. …

pli-tv-pvr1.6:2.1.pli: Anādariyaṃ paṭicca udake uccāraṃ vā passāvaṃ vā kheḷaṃ vā karontassa āpatti catunnaṃ adhikaraṇānaṃ katamaṃ adhikaraṇaṃ?
pli-tv-pvr1.6:2.1.eng: When it comes to the offense for, out of disrespect, defecating, urinating, or spitting in water, to which of the four kinds of legal issues does it belong?

pli-tv-pvr1.6:2.2.pli: Anādariyaṃ paṭicca udake uccāraṃ vā passāvaṃ vā kheḷaṃ vā karontassa āpatti catunnaṃ adhikaraṇānaṃ āpattādhikaraṇaṃ.
pli-tv-pvr1.6:2.2.eng: It belongs to legal issues arising from an offense.

pli-tv-pvr1.6:3.1.eng: The legal issues to which each offense belongs, the sixth, are finished.

pli-tv-pvr1.7:1.1.pli: Methunaṃ dhammaṃ paṭisevantassa āpattiyo sattannaṃ samathānaṃ katihi samathehi sammanti?
pli-tv-pvr1.7:1.1.eng: When it comes to the offenses for having sexual intercourse, through how many of the seven principles for settling legal issues are they settled?

pli-tv-pvr1.7:1.2.pli: Methunaṃ dhammaṃ paṭisevantassa āpattiyo sattannaṃ samathānaṃ tīhi samathehi sammanti—

pli-tv-pvr1.7:1.3.pli: siyā sammukhāvinayena ca paṭiññātakaraṇena ca, siyā sammukhāvinayena ca tiṇavatthārakena ca …pe….
pli-tv-pvr1.7:1.3.eng: they may be settled by resolution face-to-face and by acting according to what has been admitted; or they may be settled by resolution face-to-face and by covering over as if with grass. …

pli-tv-pvr1.7:2.1.pli: Anādariyaṃ paṭicca udake uccāraṃ vā passāvaṃ vā kheḷaṃ vā karontassa āpatti sattannaṃ samathānaṃ katihi samathehi sammati?
pli-tv-pvr1.7:2.1.eng: When it comes to the offense for, out of disrespect, defecating, urinating, or spitting in water, through how many of the seven principles for settling legal issues is it settled?

pli-tv-pvr1.7:2.2.pli: Anādariyaṃ paṭicca udake uccāraṃ vā passāvaṃ vā kheḷaṃ vā karontassa āpatti sattannaṃ samathānaṃ tīhi samathehi sammati—

pli-tv-pvr1.7:2.3.pli: siyā sammukhāvinayena ca paṭiññātakaraṇena ca, siyā sammukhāvinayena ca tiṇavatthārakena ca.
pli-tv-pvr1.7:2.3.eng: it may be settled by resolution face-to-face and by acting according to what has been admitted; or it may be settled by resolution face-to-face and by covering over as if with grass.

pli-tv-pvr1.7:3.1.eng: How each offense is settled, the seventh, is finished.

pli-tv-pvr1.8:0.4.eng: Summary of the previous six sections

pli-tv-pvr1.8:1.1.pli: Methunaṃ dhammaṃ paṭisevanto kati āpattiyo āpajjati?
pli-tv-pvr1.8:1.1.eng: When having sexual intercourse, how many kinds of offenses does one commit?

pli-tv-pvr1.8:1.2.pli: Methunaṃ dhammaṃ paṭisevanto tisso āpattiyo āpajjati.
pli-tv-pvr1.8:1.2.eng: One commits three kinds of offenses:

pli-tv-pvr1.8:1.3.pli: Akkhāyite sarīre methunaṃ dhammaṃ paṭisevati, āpatti pārājikassa;
pli-tv-pvr1.8:1.3.eng: when one has sexual intercourse with an undecomposed corpse, one commits an offense entailing expulsion;

pli-tv-pvr1.8:1.4.pli: yebhuyyena khāyite sarīre methunaṃ dhammaṃ paṭisevati, āpatti thullaccayassa;
pli-tv-pvr1.8:1.4.eng: when one has sexual intercourse with a mostly decomposed corpse, one commits a serious offense;

pli-tv-pvr1.8:1.5.pli: vaṭṭakate mukhe acchupantaṃ aṅgajātaṃ paveseti, āpatti dukkaṭassa—
pli-tv-pvr1.8:1.5.eng: when one inserts one’s penis into a wide open mouth without touching it, one commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-pvr1.8:1.6.pli: methunaṃ dhammaṃ paṭisevanto imā tisso āpattiyo āpajjati.

pli-tv-pvr1.8:2.1.pli: Tā āpattiyo catunnaṃ vipattīnaṃ kati vipattiyo bhajanti, sattannaṃ āpattikkhandhānaṃ katihi āpattikkhandhehi saṅgahitā, channaṃ āpattisamuṭṭhānānaṃ katihi samuṭṭhānehi samuṭṭhanti, catunnaṃ adhikaraṇānaṃ katamaṃ adhikaraṇaṃ, sattannaṃ samathānaṃ katihi samathehi sammanti?
pli-tv-pvr1.8:2.1.eng: When it comes to these offenses, to how many of the four kinds of failure do they belong? In how many of the seven classes of offenses are they found? Through how many of the six kinds of originations of offenses do they originate? To which of the four kinds of legal issues do they belong? Through how many of the seven principles for settling legal issues are they settled?

pli-tv-pvr1.8:2.2.pli: Tā āpattiyo catunnaṃ vipattīnaṃ dve vipattiyo bhajanti—
pli-tv-pvr1.8:2.2.eng: They belong to two kinds of failure:

pli-tv-pvr1.8:2.3.eng: they may be failure in morality; they may be failure in conduct.

pli-tv-pvr1.8:2.4.eng: They are found in three classes of offenses:

pli-tv-pvr1.8:2.5.pli: siyā pārājikāpattikkhandhena, siyā thullaccayāpattikkhandhena, siyā dukkaṭāpattikkhandhena.
pli-tv-pvr1.8:2.5.eng: they may be in the class of offenses entailing expulsion; they may be in the class of serious offenses; they may be in the class of offenses of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-pvr1.8:2.7.pli: kāyato ca cittato ca samuṭṭhanti, na vācato.
pli-tv-pvr1.8:2.7.eng: from body and mind, not from speech.

pli-tv-pvr1.8:2.8.eng: They belong to legal issues arising from an offense.

pli-tv-pvr1.8:2.9.eng: They are settled through three principles:

pli-tv-pvr1.8:2.10.pli: siyā sammukhāvinayena ca paṭiññātakaraṇena ca, siyā sammukhāvinayena ca tiṇavatthārakena ca …pe….
pli-tv-pvr1.8:2.10.eng: they may be settled by resolution face-to-face and by acting according to what has been admitted; or they may be settled by resolution face-to-face and by covering over as if with grass. …

pli-tv-pvr1.8:3.1.pli: Anādariyaṃ paṭicca udake uccāraṃ vā passāvaṃ vā kheḷaṃ vā karonto kati āpattiyo āpajjati?
pli-tv-pvr1.8:3.1.eng: When, out of disrespect, one defecates, urinates, or spits in water, how many kinds of offenses does one commit?

pli-tv-pvr1.8:3.2.pli: Anādariyaṃ paṭicca udake uccāraṃ vā passāvaṃ vā kheḷaṃ vā karonto ekaṃ āpattiṃ āpajjati.
pli-tv-pvr1.8:3.2.eng: One commits one kind of offense:

pli-tv-pvr1.8:3.4.pli: anādariyaṃ paṭicca udake uccāraṃ vā passāvaṃ vā kheḷaṃ vā karonto imaṃ ekaṃ āpattiṃ āpajjati.

pli-tv-pvr1.8:4.1.pli: Sā āpatti catunnaṃ vipattīnaṃ kati vipattiyo bhajati, sattannaṃ āpattikkhandhānaṃ katihi āpattikkhandhehi saṅgahitā, channaṃ āpattisamuṭṭhānānaṃ katihi samuṭṭhānehi samuṭṭhāti, catunnaṃ adhikaraṇānaṃ katamaṃ adhikaraṇaṃ, sattannaṃ, samathānaṃ katihi samathehi sammati?
pli-tv-pvr1.8:4.1.eng: When it comes to this offense, to how many of the four kinds of failure does it belong? In how many of the seven classes of offenses is it found? Through how many of the six kinds of originations of offenses does it originate? To which of the four kinds of legal issues does it belong? Through how many of the seven principles for settling legal issues is it settled?

pli-tv-pvr1.8:4.2.pli: Sā āpatti catunnaṃ vipattīnaṃ ekaṃ vipattiṃ bhajati—
pli-tv-pvr1.8:4.2.eng: It belongs to one kind of failure:

pli-tv-pvr1.8:4.4.eng: It is found in one class of offenses:

pli-tv-pvr1.8:4.5.eng: in the class of offenses of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-pvr1.8:4.7.pli: kāyato ca cittato ca samuṭṭhāti, na vācato.
pli-tv-pvr1.8:4.7.eng: from body and mind, not from speech.

pli-tv-pvr1.8:4.8.eng: It belongs to legal issues arising from an offense.

pli-tv-pvr1.8:4.9.eng: It is settled through three principles:

pli-tv-pvr1.8:4.10.pli: siyā sammukhāvinayena ca paṭiññātakaraṇena ca, siyā sammukhāvinayena ca tiṇavatthārakena ca.
pli-tv-pvr1.8:4.10.eng: it may be settled by resolution face-to-face and by acting according to what has been admitted; or it may be settled by resolution face-to-face and by covering over as if with grass.

pli-tv-pvr1.8:5.1.eng: The summary of the previous six sections, the eighth, is finished.

pli-tv-pvr1.8:5.2.eng: These eight sections were written down through the method of recitation.

pli-tv-pvr1.8:7.1.eng: “Where was it laid down, and how many,
